meanings.definition: To plan and coordinate the steps and movements of dancers in a performance.
meanings.sent1: She is choreographing a beautiful ballet for the upcoming recital.
meanings.sent2: The dance instructor spent hours choreographing the group routine.
meanings.sent3: Choreographing the dance felt like solving a fun puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her graceful movements choreographed a story of love and loss on stage.
meanings.sent5: Choreographing the dance was like painting with movement and music.

meanings.definition: To design and arrange the movements of a dance.
meanings.sent1: The choreographer is choreographing a new routine for the competition.
meanings.sent2: They are choreographing a hip-hop dance for the school talent show.
meanings.sent3: Choreographing the dance steps made her feel like a dance wizard.
meanings.sent4: The dancers moved as one, perfectly choreographing their routine.
meanings.sent5: Choreographing the dance was like crafting a beautiful dance tapestry.

meanings.definition: The act of creating and arranging dance movements.
meanings.sent1: Her choreographing of the ballet was praised by the audience.
meanings.sent2: The choreographing of the performance was flawless.
meanings.sent3: Watching the choreographing of the dance was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent4: The choreographing of the routine was a true work of art.
meanings.sent5: The choreographing of the movements told a captivating story on stage.
